module.title: feuch
module.p: feuch is a (regular) verb corresponding to the English try, attempt. The verbal noun of feuch is feuchainn.
An older alternative spelling is fiach, fiachainn.
The main uses of feuch are –

ol.li: As a strict intransitive verb, with an implicit attempted action – dh’fheuch i she tried (to do it)
As a strict transitive verb – dh’fheuch i e she tried it
As an extended transitive verb – feuch rud air duine try something out on someone – dh’fheuch i air a mac e she tried it out on her son
With an infinitival complement – feuch ri rud a dhèanamh try to do something – dh’fheuch i ri Seòras a phògadh she tried to kiss George

With an interrogative complement – feuch a bheil ... ascertain if ... – a dh’fheuchainn an robh e tinn to ascertain if he was ill; chaidh i a Lunnainn feuch an robh e tinn she wnt to London to ascertain if he was ill

box.title: feuch as an intransitive verb
box.p: feuch can be used as strictly intransitive verb, where the attempted action is understood from context –

box.title: feuch as an transitive verb
box.p: feuch can be used as strictly transitive verb, with a direct object –

box.title: feuch a bheil ...
box.p: As a kind of conjunction denoting intention –
